edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.zeroKnowledge
Class ZKPOKFiatShamirFromSigmaProver

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.zeroKnowledge.ZKPOKFiatShamirFromSigmaProver
All Implemented Interfaces:
ZKPOKProver, ZKProver
public class ZKPOKFiatShamirFromSigmaProver
extends java.lang.Object
implements ZKPOKProver

Concrete implementation of Zero Knowledge prover.

This is a transformation that takes any Sigma protocol and a random oracle (instantiated with any hash function) H and yields a zero-knowledge proof of knowledge.

This protocol is explained in depth in How to Prove Yourself: Practical Solutions to Identification and Signature Problems by A. Fiat and A. Shamir in CRYPTO 1986, pages 186-194.

The pseudo code of this protocol can be found in Protocol 2.3 of pseudo codes document at http://crypto.biu.ac.il/scapi/SDK_Pseudocode_SCAPI_V2.0.0.pdf.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

generateFiatShamirProof

public ZKPOKFiatShamirProof generateFiatShamirProof(ZKProverInput input)
                                             throws CheatAttemptException,
                                                    java.io.IOException
Let (a,e,z) denote the prover1, verifier challenge and prover2 messages of the sigma protocol.

This function computes the following calculations:

COMPUTE the first message a in sigma, using (x,w) as input

COMPUTE e=H(x,a,cont)

COMPUTE the response z to (a,e) according to sigma

RETURN (a,e,z)

Parameters:
input - can be an instance of ZKPOKFiatShamirInput that holds input for the underlying sigma protocol and possible context information cont; Or input for the underlying Sigma prover.
Returns:
ZKPOKFiatShamirMessage holds (a, e, z).
Throws:
CheatAttemptException - if the prover suspects the verifier is trying to cheat.
java.io.IOException - if failed to send the message.
